reviews.text: Let’s start with the fact that there’s 24/7 free coffee ☕️. It’s a great Irish inspired hotel, central to all the DC attractions making it a great spot if you’re up for a day of walking. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and well kept. Possibly the best part is the attached pub that reminds me of the pubs I visited in Ireland a few months prior. You’ll get a good pint of Guinness and it even has the same scent as the pubs in Ireland. A great choice for a weekend in DC. Can’t forget about the speedy valet service as well! Highly recommended.

My friend and I stayed here when we were going to be in DC for a concert. The room was small, but perfect for what we needed. The room was clean and the bathroom was gorgeous. Staff at all times were friendly and helpful. It was about a 15 minute walk to Capital One Arena and you were so close to the Capital Building you could see it! Very enjoyable stay, I would come back. They even have a super cool latte machine that can be used for free as a guest!

This is a GREAT hotel to stay in if you are visiting Washington DC. It’s small enough to give you very personal service. The bellmen hailed cabs quickly and cheerfully. The housekeeping service was daily! They worked around our schedule with no problem. One night, we had noisy neighbors. When we called, the staff took care of it immediately. We were there six nights. The breakfast a la cart was very reasonable. $7 for made to order eggs and bacon. Great French Toast! The Dubliner, connected to the hotel, was great if you wanted dinner quickly. Great location not far from the sites and close to union station. We would definitely stay again.

Stayed here for a belated birthday weekend in D.C.. The entire staff was so kind and helpful. Beds were amazing and the rooms were very clean. Views from our room were really pretty, and the complimentary coffee/espresso bar was extremely convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only downside is the surrounding location is a little bit sketchy. Lots of homeless people at night, some seemed to be clearly mentally ill. This is no fault of the hotel though.

First thing first this place was cute and inviting. The staff always said good morning and good evening. The bed was super comfy the pillows were like sleeping on clouds. The water was super hot like which was a relief from the cold as we went in January. The dubliner restaurant had delicious breakfast and late night dinner. I would go back again.

Quick here and a lot of choices. The pizza is good as is the hot food but  a little expensive- especially when they are weighing pastas and sauces. The lemon chicken is my favorite and is really good when it is fresh! They have both round and aware pizza but the Square is not really that thick.  There is not a lot of seating here and sometimes it appears a little messy. There are healthy choices including salad and fruit which are on the food bar.
Good food and friendly service. The two guys sleeping in the dining area detracted from a wholly positive experience.

No more stuffed pizza. It was my favorite growing up. I asked if they make it still and they said they discontinued over the Summer of 2022.

Only place left is Arundel Mills Sbarro that has it.
As a Pizza Specialist, this Sbarro aint never let me down.

I was greeted by Carlos who was busy prepping when I walked into the Sbarro. The selection on breakfast menu items was listed. It was a nice healthy selection so I ordered eggs,potatoes and a biscuit.I'm vegetarian. I was asked if i was dining in or taking out.The food well done was placed into an aluminum pan and given to me on a tray as I chose to dine in. The price was a bit costly I added an apple juice and my total was 9.44. If it was not for the great customer service I would have walked out but food is expensive anyway so I had no problem paying. The quality of the food was what I expected and it was a pretty decent breakfast as I was feeling a bit sick before consumption and it helped make me feel better

Amazing service, great ambiance and delicious food. The portions are small/personal for the price but delicious nonetheless. Had a few amazing vegetarian options and the waiter was kind enough to explain everything to us.

Came here for my boyfriend’s birthday and had an amazing experience. Guillermo was our server and he went above and beyond with not only us, but all of his tables to ensure everyone had a great time and was very informed about the menu items. Complimentary champagne and dessert was brought out to us, and it could not have been a better experience. Definitely worth the money spent, everything we tasted was absolutely amazing. So glad I chose this place for his birthday!

The thing that I love about the Red hen is that the menu is constantly adjusting to accommodate fresh, in season ingredients. The experience never gets old and the food is reliably delicious. It’s easiest if you have a reservation, but you can sometimes sneak in at the bar. Highest recommendation! Worth every penny, every time.

Great food, great ambiance, and great service. The food is elegantly presented and absolutely cooked to perfection. You'll struggle for a reservation during busy periods, but that's the same with all good restaurants; if you can't get a reservation, grab a seat at the bar.

All natural wines by the glass paired with amazing food and a large, airy bar in a rustic setting. Very friendly bartenders too. The whipped ricotta crostini was one of the best things I’ve ever had, and yes you can order Cacio e Pepe off the menu and it’s delicious. A lovely gem!

Absolutely amazing spot!!!! The service was incredible. The good was amazing!!! Catfish entree with Jalapeño grits and collards......A MUST! Sweet potato pancakes......A MUST! The lattes are pretty tasty. The ambience and music were really cool. The most shoebox thing is being able to read and so for books in the same space. I can't wait to come back.

As soon as you step foot inside the restaurant you are captured by the design and layout. The books that they have out for display are very interesting. Then, you have the food. I only had the shrimp and grits, but the other meals caught my attention so much that I need to go back.

My group is visiting from Ohio for a conference. The restaurant is pleasingly eclectic in its decor. The atmosphere was quaint. The server was pleasant and smile with authenticity as she assisted the three of us. The food was served hot and was pleasing plated. The taste of the good was amazing. The seasoning of the catfish, greens and cheddar and jalapeño grits was perfect. I could eat here every day.

I love the idea of this place!! They sell books! It's amazing!! The artwork is powerful and speaks volumes without spoken words. I came here with a group for my scholarship and we got a whole from to ourselves. It's a very big place with multiple rooms and a huge outdoor patio. Service was great and everyone was friendly and helpful. The ART tho 😍🤩🙌

I absolutely loved it here! I loved how the staff were just having a good time and jamming out to music while working. The girl behind the bar was living her best life with the music. The whole place has a fantastic vibe and great food. We came for brunch but I'm sure dinner is just as great!

I have never had a sublime turkey burger until I went here. Half a pound patties on toasted brioche buns with a side of thick cut fries. Great spot to hit a spot for pub food. The fries were a tad overly seasoned for my taste but I was thoroughly impressed by the burger of the day and the bison burger. Okay service. Restaurant is connected to a hotel in the back. Outdoor patio seating available. Nice atmosphere even though music was a bit too loud at times to converse.

Great place! The food is tasty and flavorful. The portions are big. The decoration is amazing. The waiters are attentive and can give you tips on how to navigate your way around the city. You can sit down, relax, and enjoy your food while listening to some beautiful Irish songs.

Had a delicious 'Capitol Hill Burger' for dinner one night and I can't complain about it. The staff were so friendly. The only issue you might have with the place is that it can get quite loud inside during the evening due to large groups of friends having a good time (can't blame them) in addition to the occasional live music performances. Personally I enjoyed the bustling atmosphere. 4 stars.

Incredible experience. The staff was extremely accommodating, saw the manager help a family out and merge several tables together for a family reunion even though it was clear that was not the norm. We only had an hour to catch our train and they rushed the order in the kitchen.

Food was simply divine, service was amazing, staff lovely, and the prices right.

Would have labeled this as 2 $$, updated menu attached (their website was incorrect), but otherwise simply lovely!

Great breakfast and spot to grab a bite before catching a train at union station. Thanks to our waiter and kitchen team. We mentioned we had a train to catch and asked if we had enough time. They said yes, kept us updated on progress and hit the mark.

A thorough menu of food and drink options in a variety of different spaces to kick back with a beverage. A cool, large bar/restaurant.

Brunch consists of a varying plates, including hot chicken and some meatless/vegetarian dishes. All we're delicious.

A cinnamon roll or two for the table makes a great starter.

Star deduction: You'll find an automatic 20% gratuity regardless of party size.

Excellent spot in the heart of Bloomingdale. New American style pub offerings with solid cocktails and exceptionally warm service.

We went for brunch and had a really great experience from start to finish. Their house Bloody Mary is the best so far I've had in DC, a robust one with just enough heat to make it interesting.

We tried the deviled eggs and they were pretty good. The eggs themselves were a bit ordinary but the jalapeno crisps were a nice touch that tipped things over to good.

My main was the sausage Benedict with their homemade sausage and it was solid, definitely worth trying. The accompanying potatoes were not memorable.

Everything else we tried including their cinnamon roll was very good.

Looking forward to returning to try more of the menu.

The best customer service experience since Covid started! I got the Honey Hot Chicken for my entrée, which was amazing. As for my drink, I’m pretty specific as to what I like. I asked for the sweetest drink on the menu and my waitress debated with the bartender to create the best drink that fitted me perfectly. Highly recommend this spot!!

A decent restaurant bar. We arrived for brunch and their were ample seating. The mimosas came in a regular glass cup. The taste might have been better if it were served in a traditional flute. Had the deviled eggs which were good, but nothing to rave about. The hot honey chicky benny was delectable!

This pub had a nice atmosphere and the staff was very friendly. We tried the Irish Coffee, which was not to our liking. The hot chicken sandwich was good. Overall, the bar had a welcoming vibe but the food and drinks we tried weren’t to our liking. Would come here again.

We went there during restaurant week for brunch. Everything was good, the food was delicious, the atmosphere was great. Our server was friendly and on time. I love it there and would go back for sure. The only reason I gave it 4 was because our server told us the champaign is $40 and he would give us some orange juice so we can make mimosa for ourself, however when the bill came, he charged us $56! When we asked why $56, he said $40 was the bottle the rest was the service for the Champagne and glasses and orange juice! I didn’t argue just because he was nice and the food was good otherwise I would have asked for manager.
Spacious and quiet place that's very nice for business meetings. I really enjoyed their steak tartare, one of the best I've had. The service was attentive and polite and food was served pretty fast.

We had the $25 prix fixe menu for restaurant week and it was amazing! The staff was very kind and the indoor decoration felt very luxurious. The service was quite prompt as well. We had made a reservation in advance so we didn't have to wait.

Had an amazing time here! The food was delicious and definitely had great portions. I had the duck and friends had other entrees - everyone loved what they ordered. Beautiful atmosphere and decorum here. I will say, my visit was extra special as two young people decided to spend forever with each other. The man was definitely happy the woman said Yes and the restaurant shared in their happiness. Beautiful scene, encourage others to come by. Parking will be on the street - stop by a few minutes early just in case you have a small walk.
The staff at Bistro Bis are top notch AMAZING! Everything I ate was so delicious and so were the drinks as well. I will definitely return to dinner here Every time I'm in DC.

Yum! Food, service and prices are great. It's an older bar with plenty of seating indoors and some seating outdoors too. I tried the chicken tenders, burger, fries and tots. If you like tots, this is your place!! I've also had the fish and chips before and it's good too. Everything comes out fresh and hot!!

I have attended this pub multiple times since 2006. The food and service is good. Typical Irish fare. The atmosphere during is legendary if you're a police officer and attend during National Police Week, as Kellys' is the go-to location to hangout.
Best hang out during police week- get there early if you want a table and expect to be there till closing! Great time.

Why visit? Classic Irish pub.  Still the same 30 years after I last set foot in here.
Overall rating (10 point scale): 10
Cuisine: Didnt eat, but assume Irish pub food
Ambience: authentic, felt like I was in Dublin
Time of day: 10pm
Wait time: NA
Size of party: 1
Food quality: NA
Best dish: Guinness pint
Favorite drink selection: Guinness pint
Best dessert: Guinness pint
Best appetizer: Guinness pint
Service rating: excellent
Parking/transit: street parking
Come here every time I visit DC. Good drinks, jukebox and good vibes. 10/10 every visit, must try the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich

So I came all the way from Vegas to have a great time with friends, and we made plans to eat at union pub. The atmosphere was nice, but unfortunately the dining experience differed. We had a party of 8 and they couldn't get anyone's order to the right place and they forgot to bring out requested items. This is not a fan fave and I recommend that you save your coins if you can or try something else!!!

Nice outdoor seating area with overhead canopy and some side plexiglass wind protection, but still good air flow. Black bean veggie burger and salad was good option for me as a vegan (minus cheese, of course), and craft beer selection was decent. Or server was attentive and helpful. Alas, the TVs showing a football game were unfortunately quite loud, even after we requested reduced sound level. Oh well. Guessing that doesn't happen all the time. Great location near Union Station Metro and Capitol Hill.

This was the worst experience at a restaurant I’ve ever had. Waiter was very inattentive and seemed agitated when we made simply requests, like that he bring us some clean glasses to drink from instead of dirty ones covered in fingerprints. One of my friends ordered the black bean burger with only lettuce and they brought it to her with no bun….. Just the patty and a piece of lettuce….. Food wasn’t good at all. I had the chicken sliders and was not impressed. Only ate two of the four. Fries were flavorless. The old bay wings were poorly seasoned as well. Chair legs and table legs were both uneven so we were pretty much wobbling the entire time we were trying to eat. Will never be dining here again. 0/5, would NOT recommend! Take your money somewhere else!

Wow the old grumpy barmaid was really rude.  The old lady with white long hair.  She snatched my Visa up and then demanded I sign it. Rude the whole time.  Yelled at me and said other half of bar was closed.  But I was just going to restroom.  Will never be back and tell everyone In DC my experience

Any place with sweet potato fries is already thumbs up for me. Aside from that, the staff was present, and friendly. The food was seasoned just right, and I loved the portions served.

We sat on the patio around lunchtime, which looked like it was used for extra storage space in some sections. A little crowded, the tables and chairs could probably be arranged to better utilize the space, or just use less of them in the space.

Beautiful place to grab a bite or cup of coffee. Not to ADA friendly if you're using a wheelchair or knee scooter as it is uneven and coble stone path. Very cute outside dinning area, friendly staff and yummy food.
Embracing ambiance, great neighborhood feel, nice music, comfortable seating and best of all, good coffee and pastry. I can't wait to return to Big Bear Cafe.

Can a place with subpar food and drinks exist if its setting is enticing enough? Apparently at Big Bear Cafe it can! So while the chocolate bear paw pastry I had was a 2/5... and the cafe au lait was a 1/5... and despite it being 11am on a Sunday 90% of the pastry offerings were gone... I guess I still enjoyed my time at Big Bear because they have some decent outdoor seating space? I ask this both sarcastically and seriously.

In all seriousness, I really hope someone else takes over this space and tries to actually make quality food and drinks. I don't say that to be mean, it just is a waste of a really nice space otherwise and the other reviews back this up.

It is very conveniently located around the corner from where I am staying in D.C

I ordered the Breakfast Sandwich with an addition of bacon. The sandwich comes with fluffy cooked eggs, a fresh english muffin, sautéed onions, cheddar and arugula. I also nabbed an orange poppyseed muffin to go along with my morning coffee.

I swung by this morning to pick up breakfast before starting work. The cafe and outdoor space itself is very cute and if I had more time this morning, I would definitely settle down to dine in.

Tldr; good spot with "ok" food, which is over priced. Come for the coffee and environment.

Don't expect to be impressed.

Went for a quick bite and loved it! Drinks are Fire 🔥BBQ is so tasty…we had brisket,ribs and wings and all were absolutely delicious! But MOST importantly the DRINKS! They were super tasty and will for sure be returning to enjoy more of the wide selection of drinks… true neighbor gem 💎!!!

Only down side is the Mac n cheese… not traditional and if you love Mac n cheese skip it - I’m not sure if it was chopped green peppers or jalapeños but hard pass !

Dropped by for their amazing food on my weeklong sightseeing trip to DC. Came by on a weeknight and the place was quite busy. My teenage son had a sandwich. He loved it. I had brisket and pork belly - both were delicious. I don’t like sweet pickles but their version paired perfectly with the meat so I ate them all. The barbecue sauce wasn’t overly spicy either, so it complemented the meat rather than overpowering it. Had potato salad and coleslaw for sides - both were good. Staff was friendly and helpful. Music was loud inside and the place had a very energetic vibe. There are covered outdoor picnic tables for dining as well. I’m already thinking of eating there again on the same trip. This place is definitely worth a visit.

Tried this local bbq place for date night and it was amazing. The brisket was very juicy and tender. The pulled pork was delicious. The fried Brussel sprouts with their signature sauce is very tasteful. The fried onions were amazing with whatever spices they coated them with. Everything was just delicious and worth the money! The staff was nice and helpful. This place is also really clean and lively.

Came here almost 2 years ago from New Jersey, and I’m sooooooo tempted to take a trip back down to DC literally just because of this place! The brisket chili was absolutely outstanding. Everything was amazing! The staff was also very welcoming and made us feel at home. But that brisket chili just hit different. I will definitely be back in the future.

Some of the best BBQ I have had in a long time. Everything was on point! The brisket...my God...so good. Wait time was not an issue at all. Frozen daiquiris was everything. My mom and I had a frozen combo of the Pink Panther and Orange Cream - delicious! Overall, great 1st time experience. Friendly staff and inviting atmosphere. Parking I would say was the only down fall, but a staff member did help us out with that...plus it is was Pride weekend 😊. Will definitely come back again. Highly recommend!

Wow! The best cup of coffee my husband and I have ever had, hands down - not an exaggeration. Way to ruin all other coffee for us. There was only one person working and the service was great, friendly and efficient. I wish we lived closer, this would be our daily coffee.

One of those places that makes you melt into your seat and feel grateful for life. We were drawn in by the smell of the roasting coffee wafting out of the chimney (pictured) and down the block.

Excellent music, warm ambiance, delicious and very very affordable coffee and food. It feels like it’s survived the regime of third-wave specialty coffee and come out thriving. Only in DC for a day but this is a must-go.

The best Iced Chai Latte and Bacon/Egg Bagel, I've ever had. The staff is friendly and the location has fantastic WIFI.

I was able to get a lot of work done.

The place does get busy because it is amazing.

Cool atmosphere. The server was on his own so had to take orders/make drinks/make food all by himself. We had to wait longer than usual but I think he did a great job. The chai was awesome and the vegan breakfast was perfect to get the day going.

Really wonderful coffee shop, and I absolutely love the Ethiopian influence. It’s something so unique to a coffee shop. Nice to have a place highlighting Ethiopian coffees!

I got a very delicious everything bagel here as well (see picture below 😜).

The shop itself has cozy, quiet vibes (at least when I was there), and great service! The other cool thing is they serve some Ethiopian food - also see the picture below! Didn’t get to try that since it was breakfast time, but would love to try it someday.

Look forward to returning.

#sidamo #coffee #tea #Ethiopian #cozy #everythingbagel

This was a fun experience to try Ethiopian food for the first time.

I went with my friends and we ordered two of the big sampler dishes and the fried fish.

The food wasn’t bad, but it wasn’t the best either. I only liked the beef stew that came in the Beef & Chicken Sampler. The vegetarian sampler wasn’t the best to be honest. Which is why I’m giving it a 3-star rating.

I can fairly say that the place was very clean and the servers were welcoming and attentive. 👍🏼

The prices were a little bit on the expensive side. Because we knew that the samplers were big, we only ordered 2 main dishes for 3 people. The total was around $60.

I would definitely have Ethiopian food again, but maybe not at this restaurant.

First time having Ethiopian food and we weren't disappointed. Delicious and full of flavor! A platter is more than enough for 2 people. Ordering is online through QR code, but very straightforward. Staff are helpful and receptive. Definitely recommend.

This was My first time trying an Ethiopian Dish. The Waitress was friendly and very helpful and suggested the Lamb Tips. I was seated and attended to very quickly. I had the Window Seat which had Bay Windows allowing a perfect view of the Capital. This made My experience ten times better. The App ordering experience was easy and contactless pay made the experience great because You could just leave when You are ready. The setup of the Food was picture worthy. The Food was Great.

I’m not the first white guy to fill myself up like an injera balloon and sweat through a dish the majority of the world considers mild, and I will not be the last. I’m also not an Ethiopian food expert, but I’ve had it a few times and this was probably the best.

The vegetarian sampler for two was really good. Of the seven items included I only didn’t care for one of them, and that was primarily because it was too spicy for me (which means fine for most everyone else). We probably would have been fine with the “for one” version of the sampler given the app and lamb entree we added. Both of those were good, but nothing special. All of the injera we got was great.

Ethiopic is by far one of the best Ethiopian Restaurant in DC. The order process is 100 % digital so don’t forget your phone. For vegetarians is a lot to eat here and my Kids also had a lot of fun to try every different flavour. I would recommend to eat one vegetarian platter for three people.

Excellent service! Wonderful nachos, the coconut shrimp appetizer was delicious. I love the sweet potato mash that it is served on. The drinks are a little pricey but where aren't they in DC. If you read a bad review about this place it just simply isn't true it's a wonderful, wonderful establishment. Staff is extremely friendly and efficient

I only gave this place a 4 out of 5 because I have only had 2 things on the menu, but it would be a 5 because I went twice back to back in the last two days. A family member spoke highly of this place & I can't wait to try more of the menu. Everything looks so good and the cornbread was amazing! I love the decor complete with giant chili light fixtures and chili pepper tables. For a train station rsstaurant, it's well deserving of it's high rating.

I usually go here for a quick dinner while waiting for the train. The Salmon Tacos are great. A good selection of beers and usually attentive service. I have been here on one occasion where we couln't get the attention of the bartender and left.

I had breakfast here on a cold day in March. The coffee was good, the service was also good. I had the mushroom and Swiss omelette that I enjoyed. This is a great place to sit and people watch while you marvel at the architecture of the train station
Food was good, service was good, and restaurant was fine. Service was slow. Took a long time to get the check.

Wonderful Chicago style food.
Decent variety of food and drinks.
They were short staffed during our visit, but the server (Paris) was super friendly.

Marie's Blueberry Mojito is flavorful, well balanced, and absolutely delicious!  10 outta 10, highly recommend!  Our train got delayed and we wandered in and she took excellent care of us!  If you need a home away from home while you're waiting for your train, this is the spot!

Seemingly understaffed, so service was a bit slow. Drinks were overpriced as expected at a train station, but they are the only restaurant with alcohol so I'll still count it as a win. Food was much better than expected and the salad was surprisingly fresh.

The absolute worst customer service! We were told to seat ourselves as we were greeted by a sign that said please wait to be seated. The waitress took forever to take our orders. Patrons came in behind us, were seated and served prior to us even being able to order. After ordering the appetizers ordered came out 5 minutes apart. Needless to say we ordered 3 different appetizers. A complete mess. Gave the waitresses clear instructions “my ticket needs to be separated.” She couldn’t even do that timely. I asked for our checks 20 minutes prior to my train departure. Then the manager comes with additional excuses. The food was decent but the service was terrible. First and last visit to Union Station UNO’s. They completely missed the mark.

Amber is an absolutely incredible waitress!  She was personable, so attentive, and very quick with her service.  She made sure we enjoyed ourselves and were taken care of.  This restaurant is a must visit because of her!

Absolutely phenomenal!! Amazing service. I recommend getting a reservation if you want to sit downstairs but other than that plenty of room just not on match days. Food portions are massive so I suggest splitting. Had the pork schnitzel and chicken tiki masala. Bartender is very knowledgeable and even with few sweet drinks made something for my taste.

Yet again a pleasure to watch football (yes soccer...) at The Queen Vic, where any Liverpool supporter feels at home. Watched the Semi-Final between France and Marocco here. Had really good beer and I reccommend the Vegan curry dish, it was big but very tasty and came with lovely nan bread. We happend to get some free Kronenberg merch from the rep who was there that day, pretty awesome.

Party of 12, no problem! The Queen Vic had us make reservations on their website for our evening dining.

We had the best time at The Queen Vic. Upstairs dining for our group was perfect.

Our group had chicken pot pie (photo)-fish n chips-speckled hen (daily special)-Brie cheese board (daily special)-and more.

Everything came out hot and delicious. Would highly recommend this place to dine and have drinks. Next time in DC area, we will definitely return.

I’ve eaten many a donuts in my life…and these donuts might’ve been some of the best in my life. Not an exaggeration. All the food was great in general, but I will have dirty dreams of those cinnamon sugar dough boys.

Food and drinks were excellent. Friend's food was so salty it was inedible. My food was *fantastic*.
The pudding and the donuts were delightful, definitely get. The pudding was probably one of the best things I've ever tasted.

The Mac n cheese gnocchi was so salty it was inedible.
The potato, cheese, and sauerkraut perogies were OUT OF THIS WORLD. Pro tip: get a side of fries to dip in the leftover gravy. You'll want it. It's outstanding.

The brussel sprouts were decent. Nothing to write home about. Didn't really go with the rest of the order, which was *my* fault, but they still were only decent.

what a great atmosphere! Employees are super friendly and kind. Their pizzas are light and very tasty . I was amazed with their bar,  Ozi made us delicious cocktails. I would definitely visit them again. I wish I could give them more than 5 stars.

I love Bacio so much. I used to come here with a whole crew of vegan runners after a long run and we were so deeply taken care of at this neighborhood gem.

I just ordered a delivery order for margarita with light vegan cheese and heavy sauce and they so beautifully made me a little pie with love and GARLIC. Bacio is the pizza place for pizza lovers alike! Vegan, vegetarian and meat eaters. They take special care and exude hometown vibes.

Truly the best pizza in DC. The right amount of sauce, a lovely crunch, and great topping options... I feel very lucky to live so close. They definitely cater to take away, but the dine in experience is perfectly lovely as well.
Pizza was delicious. The crust was just right, the topping of fresh tomatoes, mozzarella and basil very good.
The quality of the ingredients was good, but the quantity of garlic was insane.  I think someone misunderstood the assignment. 20+ cloves of garlic on a 10” pie. I’d still eat there again.

Pizza was so amazing. They have a honey sauce that goes on the top of the pizza, taste so good we ate two pizza's. And they had their own drink flavors, Sweet Root Beer and Mango Passion Fruit was my favorite. Cookies are bomb too. The staff were nice.

My favorite pizza restaurant. They have impeccable customer service with a friendly environment. Ashley was very kind with her warm smile, I appreciated her efforts to make the experience enjoyable. Waverly did an amazing job making my delicious pizza. He always very sweet and I enjoy his conversations. I love this &pizza because they accommodate our needs and make the experience worth while.

My fiancé and I came here because we were starving around 11p.m. As soon as we got there, the customer service was phenomenal. The young man at the pizza topping area was very polite and accommodating. When we went to check out, we really were hoping to tip, but their system did not allow them to add one via cards. 🥺

Now that we are actually eating our classic pepperoni’s, they are DELICIOUS!!!

The service and food will NOT let you down. Thank you!!!! 🙏🏻
Got my pizza for lunch and Ashley with the dreads was SUPERB! Real attentive and cool. I’ll definitely go back to this location just because of the great service. The pizza was fire too!

Monday Febuary 20th 10pm
I was told that they ran out of marinara sauce so they put no sauce on my pizza and none for my Knots didn't tell em they were out. Put no garlic flavoring on my knots and no Mozzarella on my knots either. When I went back to ask for sauce the woman looked shocked that I came back to ask then she gave me hot honey. They literally are serving people knots with nothing on them. Support gave me a full refund.

The food was good. The staff were stellar, very kind.  TheDC mayor just lifted her prejudice vax
mandate. I am happy to report that this subway location let us dine in without asking for vax proof.
Nice staff, good food and a cool environment.
Always a quick choice for lunch
The food tastes nice and fresh, not like it has been sitting out. The place is clean.Very nice staff, as well. If you need a quick bite to eat, you should go there.
The staff is awesome. They were very kind and was able to get my order right away.

I usually love this place. Just recently I went in and had a new debit card. I didn't know the PIN. I asked the manager to ring it as credit. He said he could not, then snatched the sandwich away and gave me a rude glare. I was wearing a hoodie and had my hood on. I felt I was profiled.

My 14 year old was ecstatic with an independent sense to walk here, after receiving a coupon in the mail he cut out with intent to use.
He came home upset that he spent $25 on two sandwiches and Gatorades, after this store told him that he can't use his coupons there.. because the "coupon machine" wasn't working.
Like, you guys couldn't manually adjust purchase? I'm not happy about this. I keep calling, but the phone just keeps ringing.
A lot of his high school peers give you guys business, you didn't have to do a kid like this.
Been coming here a while, top notch service. The main guy remembers my sandwich all the time and makes it well. Thank you.
The chicken noodle soup is to die for!! .... When they make it right lol
Love the spirit of the ladies that work there. Make me feel like family everytime I'm there.
